title: Error: unprocessable entity
body:
The int.bahn.de server seems to respond with an unprocessable entity when using `journeys`.
Just running /p/db/example.js with 

```
 let data = await client.journeys(berlinJungfernheide, m√ºnchenHbf, {
        results: 1,
        tickets: true,
 })
```

errors out at

```
		const err = new Error(res.statusText);
		            ^

Error: Unprocessable Entity
    at Object.request (file:///home/tgrossen/Projekte/Technical/db-vendo-client/lib/request.js:142:15)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
    at async Object.journeys (file:///home/tgrossen/Projekte/Technical/db-vendo-client/index.js:213:25)
    at async file:///home/tgrossen/Projekte/Technical/db-vendo-client/p/db/example.js:38:13
```
author: grssnbchr

comments.body: Sorry, I miscommitted something yesterday :( Should be fixed now. Thanks for reporting!
No worries - can confirm it works now. Thank you.

satisfaction_conditions: A fix for the 'unprocessable entity' error when using the journeys function
Ability to successfully retrieve journey data from the int.bahn.de server
Proper functionality of the example code provided in the repository

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM node:18-alpine
WORKDIR /app

# Install git for cloning the repository
RUN apk add --update git

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/public-transport/db-vendo-client.git . && \
    git checkout 6e0f3d66b904fcb069f625feef45b0c893b5ce0c

# Install dependencies (using npm install instead of npm ci)
RUN npm install

# Set the default command to keep the container running
CMD ["tail", "-f", "/dev/null"]
